profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-04-06 16:23:46 -0400.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Use of original papers requires an appointment and is limited to the Archives' Washington, D.C., Research Center. Microfilmed materials must be consulted on microfilm. Contact Reference Services for more information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed material including clippings, catalogs and exhibition announcements.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: REEL LA 1: Announcements and catalogs; biographical material; and extracts from critics.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: REEL 3471: 6 exhibition catalogs, 5 clippings, 2 pages of reviews, and a copy of THE GREAT WEST, (1973) which consists of 138 illustrations by Rogers.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reels LA 1 and 3471 available at Archives of American Art offices and through interlibrary loan.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: Reel LA 1: Originals returned to the lender, Charles B. Rogers, after microfilming.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Painter, printmaker, craftsman, teacher; Great Bend, Kansas and California. Died 1987. Painter of western America landscapes and scenes. Assistant director-manager of the Huntington Hartford Foundation, Pacific Palisades, California.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Material on reel 3471 donated by Rogers, 1973. Material on reel LA 1 lent for microfilming by Rogers.
